Body: Description: Hi Sean, This Vulnerability was found on the Stealthbits server. The recommendation is to patch or upgrade. Is this known to your team and is there a patch to address the issue? Thanks Peter Sterianos Sr. Information Security Analyst Cyber & Information Security Peter.Sterianos@point32health.org Office: (781) 612-4322 Cell: (781) 760-1153

What We've Learned Updated: Customer reported that Vulnerability (CVE-2024-53677) was found on the NEA server.  

Customer is US based. 

I posted a question in SWAT to clarify if this is a known vulnerability or not:
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/message/19:2f33cf4c06364f4c8644adce095eb161@thread.tacv2/1734706120805?tenantId=097499ff-179d-4959-ab02-86d364125bfc&groupId=72f83b71-3180-482b-b588-9595342c5a50&parentMessageId=1734706120805&teamName=SWAT%20Teams%3A%20Product%20Discussions%2C%20PM%20Q%26A%2C%20Feedback&channelName=NEA%20Core&createdTime=1734706120805

If this is not a known vulnerability - then it must be reported as per these instructions:
https://nwxcorp.sharepoint.com/sites/NetwrixTechnicalSupport/SitePages/T1-Support-Engineer-Handbook.aspx#reporting-a-security-concern

Next Steps Updated: Support is waiting for a reply in SWAT channel regarding Vulnerability (CVE-2024-53677). 
Notifying Tay Caliguiri as well because as per instructions from T1 #reporting-a-security-concern this case needs escalation so that it can be reported to RnD.

Confirmed with Ethan Israel in SWAT that if the customer is not currently using the NEA Survey Action module, the offending file can be removed:%SAInstallDir%ActionsSurveyWebServletWEB-INFlibstruts2-core-6.3.0.2.jar

#EAM -- TRC

Current Status: Awaiting R&D

Last Update: Issue has been mitigated for the customer by removing the offending Apache file, but they wish to keep the ticket open until a patch has been released.

 

Additional Info/Follow Up: Dev is expected to begin investigating 1/22

On Escalation Ticket # 00430399 the new comment has been added: Michael Burrofato: @Salesforce @Ethan Israel The vulnerability has been patched. Patch will be available in the next scheduled CU (01/31/2025).

Next Steps Updated: Issue has been remediated in the customer environment as they removed the offending apache struts file (not using/licensed for Survery AM).

A patch has been released in NEA v11.6.0.132+, which now uses Apache Struts 6.7.0. Customer has been notified of this, we are waiting to hear back if they'd like assistance upgrading.

Next Steps Updated: Last Customer Follow-Up: 2/18

Issue has been remediated in the customer environment as they removed the offending apache struts file (not using/licensed for Survery AM).

A patch has been released in NEA v11.6.0.132+, which now uses Apache Struts 6.7.0. Customer has been notified of this, we are waiting to hear back if they'd like assistance upgrading.
